thread.title: Learner driver charged over crash that killed girlfriend and baby faces Burnie court - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)
thread.title_full: Learner driver charged over crash that killed girlfriend and baby faces Burnie court - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)

title: Learner driver charged over crash that killed girlfriend and baby faces Burnie court - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)
text:
Learner driver charged over crash that killed girlfriend and baby faces Burnie court Posted February 28, 2017 13:22:46 Map: Burnie 7320 
A 19-year-old Burnie man who is charged over a crash that killed his teenage girlfriend and their baby has faced the Magistrates Court. 
Andrew John Sheals is yet to enter pleas to two counts of negligent driving causing death, disobeying a give way sign, being a learner driver driving unaccompanied by a licensed driver, failing to display a clearly visible "L" plate and using a vehicle that contravened standards of a safe and roadworthy condition. 
Hayley Maree Best, 16, and her two-month-old son died when the car they were passengers in drove into the path of a truck on the Bass Highway at the intersection with Deep Creek Road near Wynyard in June last year. 
Sheals' lawyer Katie Edwards told the court the matter would likely be resolved at his next appearance. Photo: Hayley Best and her baby son died in the crash. (Supplied: Facebook) 
Ms Edwards said she was awaiting a report on Sheals that would not be ready for several months, but did not say what it was in reference to. 
Sheals, who was dressed in a red-checked flannelette shirt and a navy blue jacket did not speak during the court appearance. 
He was released on bail and ordered to return to court to enter pleas on May 1. 
The intersection where the crash occurred is one of several between Cooee and Wynyard scheduled to be upgraded. 
Waratah Wynyard Council said a final design was being developed following community consultation.
